intro: Polytaenia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered polytaenia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, white petals and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Polytaenia albiflora is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
